edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.classproject.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GridMember, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NinjaOctopi, Taha

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
implements GridMember, java.io.Serializable
    The Entity class is an abstract class that possesses a boolean and an integer. This is shared between the ninjas and the player.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[] position
      The integer array size 2 position keeps track of an entities's position.
      private boolean seen
      The boolean seen is mainly used for the ninjas, this attribute depends on whether or not the player is within range to actually see the ninja.

    • Field Detail

      • seen

        private boolean seen
        The boolean seen is mainly used for the ninjas, this attribute depends on whether or not the player is within range to actually see the ninja.

      • position

        private int[] position
        The integer array size 2 position keeps track of an entities's position. This array will change dynamically as the ninjas and the player will be moving around constantly.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity()

    • Method Detail

      • isSeen

        public boolean isSeen()
        The isSeen method will return the boolean above. If the entity is seen, their toString method will display their specialized string that represents the entity. Which is usually a ninja.
        Specified by:
        isSeen in interface GridMember

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int row,
               int col)
        The setPosistion method will constantly change the size 2 array position everytime an entity makes their move.

      • getPosition

        public int[] getPosition()
        The getPosition method will take the size 2 array position and return the entire array to whatever method that called it. This is mainly to move something to an adjacent square on the grid.

      • see

        public void see()
        The see method will make the boolean seen to true. This method is called whenever the player is adjacent to a square. All squares adjacent to the player will be changed to true so it is considered as "seen".
        Specified by:
        see in interface GridMember

      • resetSee

        public void resetSee()
        The resetSee method is called to keep something from being seen. If a player saw a square, then moved away from that square, that square would still be considered seen and reveal whatever is on that square. This method fixes that problem.
        Specified by:
        resetSee in interface GridMember

      • isSomething

        public boolean isSomething()
        The isSomething method is always true for an entity is always something. The only time the isSomething boolea is false is when it is an instance of empty member.
        Specified by:
        isSomething in interface GridMember
